title: How have phone calls changed with smartphones?

korean: 스마트폰이 나오면서 전화통화 자체가 많이 줄어든 것 같아요.
예전에는 통화가 거의 유일한 실시간 소통 방법이었잖아요.
지금은 카톡, 문자, SNS 메시지 등 선택지가 너무 많죠.
그래서 오히려 전화하는 게 부담스럽게 느껴질 때도 있어요.
갑자기 전화 오면 '무슨 일이지?' 하고 걱정되기도 하고요.
카톡 영상통화나 줌으로 얼굴 보면서 얘기하는 게 자연스러워졌어요.
코로나 때는 특히 영상통화를 정말 많이 썼던 것 같고요.
예전에는 소리가 끊기거나 잡음이 많았는데 지금은 깨끗하거든요.
와이파이 통화도 가능해서 해외에 있어도 부담 없이 전화할 수 있고.
근데 사람들이 전화 받는 걸 더 꺼리게 된 건 좀 아쉬워요.
english: Since smartphones came out, phone calls themselves have decreased a lot, I think.
In the past, calls were pretty much the only way to communicate in real-time.
Now we have so many options like KakaoTalk, texts, SNS messages, you know.
So sometimes making a phone call actually feels like a burden.
When someone calls out of the blue, I get worried like 'What happened?'
Video calls have become super common too.
It's natural now to talk face-to-face through KakaoTalk video or Zoom.
During COVID especially, we used video calls a ton.
The call quality has gotten way better too.
In the past, the sound would cut out or there'd be lots of noise, but now it's clear.
WiFi calling is possible too, so you can call without worrying even when you're abroad.
But it's a bit sad that people have become more reluctant to answer calls.
